name: Haloquadratum walsbyi C23
description: Haloquadratum walsbyi C23. The type strain of Haloquadratum walsbyi; a square organism that dominates hypersaline waters. H.walsbyi is the first archaea identified that is probably able to synthesize sialic acid. These modifications, along with the potential capacity to synthesize and poly-gamma-glutamate capsule, probably create an aqueous shield and in the case of the capsule may also help maintain the unique shape of the cell. C23 is the type strain for the species, and was isolated from an Australian solar saltern.
